str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
Puny; especially neuter somewhat.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From aion; perpetual.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and a derivative of artios; to complete thoroughly, i.e. Repair or adjust.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a presumed derivative of histemi; to set fast, i.e. to turn resolutely in a certain direction, or to confirm.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To strengthen. From sthenos; to strengthen, i.e. confirm.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To found, lay the foundation (lit. and met.). From themelios; to lay a basis for, i.e. erect, or consolidate.
